website_summaries.verdict: Not only has it earned praise for producing excellent results, but this nicely-constructed wood shoe stretcher also comes in sizes suited for men's and women's shoes.
pros: 14 holes for targeting areas that cause foot discomfort

customer_reviews.title: Good investment in combination with liquid stretcher
customer_reviews.text: This product though expensive has been working like a charm. I got a tip to wet a paper towel with the liquid leather stretcher, insert the wet paper towel in the area of the shoe you want to stretch, then use the FootFitter 2-way shoe stretcher to stretch as desired. Jackpot!! In 2 days I have stretched 2 pairs of sandals to desired width. I tried to use the liquid stretcher alone in 2 occasions and it did not stretch the shoes. So, I don't regret by the FooFitter 2-way shoe stretcher. Good investment.
customer_reviews.author: Amandine

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE!!
customer_reviews.text: Either I have a terribly made one or this is just junk... it does not lengthen and Widen at the same time like it says. Every time I go to widen it then the length moves and when I lengthen it then the toe closes. Going to be really annoying that I’ll have to lengthen individually from widening (which I am supposed to be able to do at the same time... and since it only comes with one I’ve now gone from double the amount of time to quadrupling the amount of time.) I was fine with doing the shoes individually but having to do each shoe twice is extremely annoying.
customer_reviews.author: KingsQueen

customer_reviews.title: Much more convenient than taking shoes to a cobbler
customer_reviews.text: Works great for lengthening shoes and widening toe boxes for a wide range of shoes (not just boots). A wonderful secret weapon against anatomically incorrect women's shoes. Until shoe designers come to their senses, you need this especially if you are blessed with Morton's neuroma as I am. This was the best solution for controlling pain. There are instructions online, but it's easy enough to figure out how this works. Caveat: the recommended stretching time of 6-8 hours is enough for thin, soft leather, but not if the leather is stiff. I had to leave it in for several days, twisting the knob a bit further each day to increase the stretch.
customer_reviews.author: CathyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Does not stand up to the test of time - Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this a few months ago for bunions and wanted to get my winter shoes stretched so I could wear more than just a couple pairs. It started out great, but now this item will not stretch while under pressure. It separates out of your shoes, but not in them? I have emailed them, but with no response. A lot of money for something that only works a few months. Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Julianne

customer_reviews.title: No lasting results without shoe stretch spray.
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality, durable, product, but its effect is only temporary as far as I can tell— from what I’ve been able to discern, to have any lasting results it requires boot and shoe stretch spray. The product description doesn’t makee that clear. As expensive as one stretcher is (doesn’t come in a pair), you’d expect the 4 oz. bittle of stretch spray to be included. Because it doesn’t do what it says on its own, I can’t rate it more than 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: CSGutz

customer_reviews.title: Stripped screw threading
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this to work. It looks and feels nice. But, the flaw is the poor quality threading. The threading stripped out on the screw first time I used it. The screw just slips though the nut. The shoe horn will not widen. :(
customer_reviews.author: Zephyr

customer_reviews.title: It broke down after a few uses ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is very well made, meaning the wood looks real nice, heavy and beautiful carved ... however it broke down after a few uses. There is only one so you have to change between the shoes every so often. When it broke, it had passed some time since purchasing them, changing the shoe was difficult to do mainly remembering to do it. So I purchased a cheap brand with two. And I loved the cheap ones. I am always using them in pair and they haven't broke, and they are plastic, it looks cheaply made but they have lasted for a long time :)))
customer_reviews.author: An Investor

customer_reviews.title: Great for adjusting running shoes for greater comfort and better fit
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product to adjust the sizing on several pairs of running shoes. In every case the range of stretching the product provides has made my comfort increase considerably. With the yearly changes to even trusted and preferred running shoes, this product has made the slightly narrowed or slightly shortened shoes wearable and comfortable. I had owned a plastic version and it cannot compare. This product is worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: L. Reis

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but read the directions on how to get the length stretched, and have a shoe horn handy!
customer_reviews.text: The Foot Fitter was difficult to get into the shoe which is a loafer, so has no laces to allow loosening the shoe. But by using a shoe horn we were able to get it in. Stretching worked very well AFTER READING THE INSTRUCTIONS - turning the various dials has to be done in different directions. Once we figured that out, the stretcher worked very well, and we did not have to use any shoe stretch spray or heat, we just left the stretcher in for 2 days and gradually increased the stretch. The shoes are now wearable without pain!! I just ordered another one for women's shoes and will be happily using that one, as well.
customer_reviews.author: sherrye123

customer_reviews.title: Well made, seems to work, but is not intended for boots
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on the recommendation of a friend who really liked hers and felt it was very well made and designed. And it is those things. Unfortunately, I wanted to stretch a pair of boots, and this is not intended for boots. My fault for not being more careful before I purchased it... but the product information on Amazon doesn't actually say that it can't be used on boots. I only learned that when I read the instructions when the product arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Up North

customer_reviews.title: Wel- constructed shoe stretcher.
customer_reviews.text: Really have a need to enlarge the width of my right shoes due to an arthritic condition. If anything will work, this shoe stretcher will. It is substantially constructed and heavy duty. I also bought a liquid shoe stretcher to apply with it. I love the metal knobs included to accommodate specific areas to target for size increases in the shoe box area. Does not work easily on boots because of the wood piece that is supposed to slide into the heel. So I purchased the boot stretcher as well. Very hopeful since I love my shoes and boots and want to wear them comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Susan M. Evanoff

customer_reviews.title: Cannot place stretch "Button" where needed, not enough strength to stretch shoe
customer_reviews.text: The quality is good however the design is bad. I cannot place the button to stretch at the bottom on where the leather meets the soul of the shoe as the wood curves up, and there is no hole to place the button at the bottom where it needs to be stretched. I am trying to stretch high quality shoes (over $300 Dollars) and there is not enough strength to stretch even with stretching solution. I cant return the shoes as I wore them for a day hoping it would stretch a little.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cude

customer_reviews.title: Definitely buy these wood and metal ones instead of plastic.
customer_reviews.text: Good wood and metal quality. Plastic options came in a pair for the same price but got reviews with breakage concerns during use. I thought it odd that these are not sold in pairs and required separate purchase selection. I would think that most people with shoe issues would want to use them on their left and right shoes simultaneously during the 24-48 hour recommended stretching period; otherwise, it would take 4 days to wear the pair of shoes if you get it right the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 1 use.  Nice wood, cheap metal threads stripped and locked up.
customer_reviews.text: This would appear to be a good solid product but it broke after only 1 attempt at stretching a shoe. The threaded spline locked up on the spreader mechanism inside with shoe, then it stopped expanding. It also looks like the wood is stripped out. Impossible to figure out how to return it on Amazon. I bought the cheap plastic stretchers and even though they are cheap and plastic, work much better. The volume of this device is also too much. You'll get the top of the shoe stretched more than you might want if you are only after stretching the width. A Little unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: FritzB.

customer_reviews.title: Can recommend. as it is made of plastic, never smells, very hygienic for others to use as well.
customer_reviews.text: everything good , make product use easy and exactly as advertised. The bungs (2) needed a bit of blue tag to stay in place, not a biggie, as all others fitted perfectly. I done so many shoes, lend it to friends,too and it really does the job in conjunction with a shoe stretch spray. Can recommend. as it is made of plastic, never smells, very hygienic for others to use as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ernie New Zealand

customer_reviews.title: Simple to set, effective tool... Now my wife wants one.
customer_reviews.text: I read multiple reviews prior to buying this product. But I had an expensive pair of Shoes I purchased while in Scotland. The leather thick and stiff, meant to last a lifetime. Was able to successfully and easily stretch both width and length for a nice comfortable fit. I didn’t pre-treat, just left the shoe stand for 2 days with stretcher installed. Checked fit, adjusted and let stand 1 more days. Repeated process for the second shoe, which had slightly different needs. First set width turning T-handle (increase width clockwise), then adjust length using sliver knob (increase length counter clockwise). Simple to use. Effective. Did a second pair for minor width stretch. Now on third pair.
customer_reviews.author: David Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Works very well and has saved my feet
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet for a woman and even size wide shoes aren't wide enough. This stretcher has made all my shoes fit comfortably. It says not for use on wide shoes but I've used it with success. I do not use any sprays, I just stretch it until there is resistance, then stretch again in 24-48 hours and let sit for another day. For two shoes it takes about 5 days but it's very worth it. I have had success on leather and synthetic shoes. I have not tried it on sneakers yet but that's next.
customer_reviews.author: Amsat

customer_reviews.title: Great product. A bit more expensive than other options ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. A bit more expensive than other options on the market, but this is solid wood and looks like it will hold up for a long time. The bunion spacers are exactly what I needed to help make room in the toe box of a pair of shoes that cut across the top of my foot in an odd way. Great customer service as well. My stretcher was missing the spacers when it arrived and they immediately sent me a new set.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney K. Ledger

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. I had 2 pair of expensive leather boots that just killed my little toe on my right foot. This fixed it. Be careful not to stretch your shoe/ boot lengthwise if not needed. I almost did that on one boot without thinking, so don't extend it length wise by accident. On Th second boot I just shoved it in there as far add I could then turned the crank for width. Now I can wear my boots and not kill my pinky toe.
customer_reviews.author: iluvxlr8in

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but there's a Design Defect that Causes Wrong Part of Shoe to be Stretched
customer_reviews.text: It was well made and sturdy and it stretched my shoe, but it's got a design defect. The heal is straight, which means that it stretches the top of the shoe that goes around your ankle, and that's the part of the shoe that often does NOT need stretching. The heel piece needs to be bulb-shaped to prevent this. I'm going to see if inserting a shim at the heel will help with this, and if that doesn't work, I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: While the wood makes this feel heavy and expensive, it does not actually contribute anything extra to its stretching abilities. You only receive 1 stretcher, which is odd because typically most people will be using it on both shoes. Finally, on the day I received it, I used it to stretch a ballet flat. Since there was only one stretcher, for the other shoe in the pair, I used a cheap plastic stretcher (also from amazon). The wood stretcher did not open as far as the plastic one, which was a third of the price. I would return it, but I already threw away the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. This has done a great job of stretching several pairs of my shoes. Please note, I wear and a 10 or 11. If you wear a smaller size you may have trouble getting the "heel" part into your shoe. You do need to leave it in at least 24 to 48 hours to get a really good stretch. I have used it for both length and width with good success. I do think that the threaded mechanism that widens the toe could easily be stripped as you turn the handle. I may buy another so that I can do a pair of shoes at one time.
customer_reviews.author: Meami

customer_reviews.title: Size Small does NOT fit size 6.5 shoe
customer_reviews.text: The tree is billed to fit 3.5-6.5 women’s shoe. While the tree works for the front of a 6.5 shoe, the post for stretching the back will not fit into a 6.5 shoe as you can see in the picture. Thus, it will not fit into a smaller size either. The purported sizing for women is completely wrong. Unfortunately the seller was not particularly helpful in this regard. Otherwise, the tree is well made, but unfortunately I can’t really use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amina Henriksen

customer_reviews.title: Good, not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: The product works. I believe the rod could be a bit longer. Or, an additional properly contoured block could be provided to go up against the back (heel) of the shoe. The additional block would be the better option. Why? When you turn the rod IOT expand the front block it shortens the rod so that when you go to stretch you might run out of length. Additional holes on the top of the front block to allow more options with the supplied pins (plugs).
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: The best shoe stretchers I have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 10.5 to 11 men's shoe. By mistake, I ordered the Men's Large size stretcher. I could barely fit the stretcher inside my 10.5 shoes. And even my size 11 shoes were a tight fit (my mistake). I returned the Large and ordered a Men's Medium. Much better. These stretchers are very well made in comparison to the other (cheap) stretchers I have bought in the past. I didn't want to spend the money on these. But now that I have them, I realize that I made a good decision. I have been able to stretch 3 or 4 pairs of shoes that were slightly tight. That in itself has helped to pay for these stretchers.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: I'm so happy!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 of these because I have several narrow toed shoes that I wanted to stretch a bit. Regular shoe horns did not work. These are amazing! I put them in and leave them for 2 days and my shoes fit perfectly. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ramblin Rose

customer_reviews.title: A Wonderful solution!
customer_reviews.text: I really like the foot fitter stretchers as I own several of them. They work well and are the cause of great joy when it comes to stretching my shoes. The only problem I have with this is trying to find out how to repair them?? I have a few that have grown stiff and cannot turn properly and some seem to have gotten off track?? I am not sure but if anyone knows how to repair them - they should last forever
customer_reviews.author: Sonja's stuff

customer_reviews.title: 100 % better then the two-for-$22 shoe stretchers
customer_reviews.text: 100 % better then the two-for-$22 shoe stretchers! These are smooth, well finished hardwood with no knots. The wedge (which does a lot of the work) is made of metal. The only reason for not 5 star is that only one set of spot relief plugs. :-/ Seems like a trivial way to save a few pennies on such a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, but needs a couple more accessories to adapt to shoe type
customer_reviews.text: The width adjustment is my primary reason to purchase. Trying to stretch low heal shoes, the heel catch does not conform well to the heel of the shoe, so the top rim gets most of the length stretch. The 'bunion' adapters are way too big for small shoe sizes - they need to be flatter. (Don't really need these though). I need to stretch width both near the toe and across the main section. It would be nice to have an adjustable distance setting piece at the toe to set where the width stretching takes place.
customer_reviews.author: SWW

customer_reviews.title: This thing is SOLID and it WORKS.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is just works. It's amazing how much harder hard wood is compared to pine or some of the softer stuff they use for everything nowadays. Anyway - I could drag this behind my truck for a hundred miles and I bet it would be just fine. I'm expecting to have it for the rest of my life.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best one
customer_reviews.text: I have tried most if not all of this kind of product on Amazon. This one is the best as it is made of sturdy, heavy wood and metal, the working parts are sturdy and smooth as well, the wood is smooth and sealed, the mechanism work well and this stretches width and length. Works extremely well. Foot Fitter is a little more $$ but it is well worth the difference in price--THE best!!
customer_reviews.author: sassy lassy

customer_reviews.title: It has a very high quality and sturdy build that's apparent before using
customer_reviews.text: The FootFitter is one of my most satisfying purchases ever. It has a very high quality and sturdy build that's apparent before using. I wear a size 15 shoe and the XL version works perfectly for stretching my right shoe, which is necessary to create a workable fit since I broke that foot years ago and the healing enlarged it. Consequently, I had four pair of high quality shoes, which were unwearable due to the tightness. The XL FootFitter stretched each of those right shoes until now every one is a comfortable fit. This product saved each of those pairs, which made it a great purchase in addition to its admirable finish and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Pasha

customer_reviews.title: Strong & Solid Construction
customer_reviews.text: Strong and solid construction. Works well. Unfortuneatly, the shoes don't stretch as much as I had hoped and can only get about 1/4 size increase,so you probably wont get a full 1/2 size jump but you will see some relief. Stretches wider better than length, due to side tie inserts provided. The handles or levers could be slightly larger for added torque to make tightening and loosening slightly easier. Can only stretch one shoe at a time.
customer_reviews.author: IamKrusty

customer_reviews.title: Could be much better if R/L specific
customer_reviews.text: Useful but ultimately not that well designed. First off, I bought two and the sizes of the wooden heel did not match. The shape is unilateral which means it's not specific to right or left and given its pointy toe shape, it widens the entire forefoot rather than the one place I needed it- the big toe area which I cannot affect with this stretcher. The other thing to note is that it's better at stretching width than length and hard to control width vs length since it happens simultaneously.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great until it breaks
customer_reviews.text: So, I liked these so much that I bought two of them! And they are not cheap. However, within four months, the threads on both of the stretchers wore off, meaning they wouldn't work, and couldn't be fixed. FootFitter sent me one replacement (and told me this was an exception to their policy that, if you buy on amazon, you only have 30 days to return/replace) , and that replacement has broken now too (same problem with the worn threads). So, I'm basically tossing $80 worth of shoe stretchers. Maybe this was a bad batch, but considering all three stretchers broke (wore out) in the same way within three months, I'd be very wary of purchasing these right now.
customer_reviews.author: Eamazon

customer_reviews.title: Good for work on the toe area of your shoe.
customer_reviews.text: The shoe stretcher is a good quality in materials, but the way it stretches is that it widens only by the toes of the shoe. If you need the top over the middle of your foot stretched, the stretcher does not open wide enough. I over widened, and the metal mechanism inside of the wooden block came popping out of the shoe stretcher. My husband was able to work on it and put the "guts back into" the wooden shoe last. I am sure it stretches the toe areas just fine, but it will not widen the shoe all the way back.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Klooster

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: My experience with this product: I carefully followed directions and it worked exactly as expected. I am delighted to be able to stretch the width on a shoe at home and not have to do to a repair shop. I understand that some reviewers had difficulty. I wonder it they did not take enough time to carefully work the stretcher down into the shoe? You need do this slowly and meticulously and then experiment with the correct tension for stretching. It may take a couple tries to get it right, but I really like this product.
customer_reviews.author: J. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: It works well
customer_reviews.text: This unit works quite well if you realize that it's not magic and that there is a limit to how far the stretch can go. I have used it on two athletic shoes with great success by soaking them first, applying reasonable torque and then letting the shoes dry out for a few days before removing the shoe sizer. PUT SOME OIL ON THE THREADED SHAFT for easier operation and the threads will last longer. The stainless steel parts are a softer alloy than normal.
customer_reviews.author: Stan Bowman

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stretcher to widen a pair of boat-style shoes that previously hurt my feet. After wetting the inside of my shoe with isopropyl alcohol, I tightened the FootFitter stretcher where I needed more room, and left it for a day. The result: perfect fitting footwear! I recommend this tool for its heavy duty design, materials quality, and easy operation.
customer_reviews.author: wagne045

customer_reviews.title: Well made, versatile shoe stretcher.
customer_reviews.text: Love the shoe stretcher! Has metal 'buttons' that can be inserted for specific area stretching (like using a Mr Potato Head). I bought the one for boots my mistake, but I can use it in my shoes and it is working out very well for the front part of my shoes - which is the only place I need extra room. Shoe form is made with quality wood and the buttons are metal. Great product for the price too.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I used this to stretch a boot of a purchased from Amazon Born pair of booties that fit perfectly on my left foot, but pinched on the right. The stretcher is well made, the instructions are clear, and 8 hours laters, the boot feels great. There are several small metal additions to the wooden foot that allow customization for something like a bunion or hammertoe. I’m giving the tool a day to rest, then on to a pair of high-heeled Cole-Haan loafers that are too snug on my aging (widening) feet after 22 years. Love this. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Grey Parrot

customer_reviews.title: Well made and useful.
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made, useful tool. The holes could be a bit better-drilled, more perpendicular to the surface, but you can always drill more of your own, to suit your individual deformities... As a nice bonus, I received chromed metal bumps instead of the black (presumably plastic) ones shown. The tool works well, operates smoothly, and is well made overall. As we age, we begin to need things like this... Ah well, better than the alternative.
customer_reviews.author: isiton?

customer_reviews.title: Very effective. Nice. Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I knew about this product years ago. Very reliable. Be sure and get the right size and be patient with it - it can take a couple of days to stretch strong leather shoes. And definitely don't try to save money by purchasing an alternative with plastic parts... it takes a LOT of force to stretch a shoe, and this tool is capable of it, while there are many other tools that look similar but can never stand up to the challenge.
customer_reviews.author: BPM

customer_reviews.title: I now wear the shoes which feel fine. Needless to say
customer_reviews.text: I received my Foot Fitter this week and put it in my New Balance 608 (12 EEE) athletic shoes. I had been told by a cobbler who has stretched other shoes for me that the length on the athletic shoe can not be stretched. I had considered giving the new shoes away because of the discomfort. They were no problem for the Foot Fitter. I now wear the shoes which feel fine. Needless to say, I won't be seeing the cobbler again for any stretching in the future.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: High price implied much better quality. Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Cheap plastic handle broke when tightening by hand. This product would never hold up for more than about one millimeter of stretching. High price implied much better quality. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Mike - Venice FL

customer_reviews.title: I like high quality and this is what I expected. Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shoe stretcher, because I have a lot of shoes that were too narrow or had some specific places that hurt and could not use them. I have a lot of shoes for a men and many of them very expensive (bought them in Europe and USA from the best shoemakers). The Footfitter is exactly what I needed. It works well and does the job. The stretcher is sturdy and very well made. My size is 11 and I decided to buy the ones for 11.5 and they are perfect! I can only recommend these stretchers.
customer_reviews.author: CarIhl

customer_reviews.title: Foot fitter is very well constructed all wood and metal parts
customer_reviews.text: I’m so glad that I found this!! I just bought a pair of sandals and they were too narrow.. so I started looking, and found the foot fitter! It’s made very well, you definitely will not be disappointed I give it a A+. I bought the smaller foot fitter for women, the one that will stretch the width and length if needed. And it works!! The only thing that I found is it took a little longer to achieve the stretch that I needed. The instructions say 6 - 8 hours. I checked my shoes at that point but put the foot fitter back in. That didn’t bother me though because it work's
customer_reviews.author: HEIDI D

customer_reviews.title: This is for only one shoe not a set
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty disappointed to realize that I just paid $40 for only one shoe stretcher. I assumed it would be a set. Most of us have two feet, seems a given this would be sold as a pair. Especially for the price. I will say that it seems sturdy but now I have to wait twice as long as I have to stretch each shoe separately. I'm not paying another $40, so. I was also unaware that you needed a spray. I feel like if it's such a requirement, that too should come in the set or at least be mentioned in bold at the top of the product page.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Return service does not work well at all.
customer_reviews.text: First delivery had neither metal “bunion plugs” nor any instructions.Return shipment has been a problem in that I dropped off package at UPS store 10 days ago and have been unable to track return being told the Amazon service provided has “consolidation” and normal tracking is not provided. When second shipment arrived I found product to be as expected,a quality product that I expect to last a very long time.Performs well in both widening and lengthening shoes.
customer_reviews.author: William J Lemoine

customer_reviews.title: Nice wood expander
customer_reviews.text: I like the way it is built, enough leverage to do what you need. It comes with these inserts to help expand in some specific area. They work, but very easy to loose them. Snapping it or having a storage place with in them would be a plus. Lost on of them already. It also did not work very well on my work shoes, helped some, but not enough.
customer_reviews.author: Cea JaysTop Contributor: Arduino

customer_reviews.title: Good item, but not carefully made.
customer_reviews.text: This stretcher is... Ok. It mostly seems well made. That said, the bumps you insert into the "foot" fit poorly. The holes in the wooden part are not drilled well, so the bumps stick out at odd angles. This, and the looseness of the holes, makes it harder to use. It would be a five star product if the holes were drilled right.
customer_reviews.author: J. Keller

customer_reviews.title: Magical!
customer_reviews.text: Magical! Like many people, my closet has a half dozen pair of shoes that are a bit tight. Those half dozen shoes I had avoided wearing mostly, especially if I know ahead it was going to be a long day. But it's a shame, the investment I have in those expensive shoes is substantial. So, in search of what to do I chose this shoe stretcher....and it works fantastic! One day in the stretcher and my toes are happy again! Product seems to be excellent quality, the parts that count are metal, very smooth and nicely finished wood. Highly recommended, can save many hundreds of dollars in shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Just Some Guy

customer_reviews.title: pieces fall off easily. I'm trying to hold it together and not ...
customer_reviews.text: I had tried a shoe stretcher from a friend. Couldn't wait to get my own. Sure, it fits as expected. But it broke right a way. Difficult to use, pieces fall off easily. I'm trying to hold it together and not buy another, but am very disappointed with the lack of quality. I even read the reviews but now I take them more seriously. Don't buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Ohio's Donna

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth The Money
customer_reviews.text: If your shoe is too short, then it is good. It does not do "wide" well. The toe pieces don't stay in place. They fall out while you are wrestling to get the unit into the shoe. I found another shoe stretcher that comes in a set of two and only costs $24.95. I've had much more success with them.
customer_reviews.author: Fairred

customer_reviews.title: Did better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of shoes online but they were very narrow for my feet. Put the shoe stretcher in the shoes 24 hours later they were fitting great. I must admit I was surprised how well the stretchers worked. I am highly pleased and would recommend them to family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: D. Leiter

customer_reviews.title: Made my shoes wearable!
customer_reviews.text: I used this on some character shoes by Capezio. The shoes were great, but I apparently have two different sized feet and some other issues. I used this with some shoe stretching spray, also available on Amazon. It really worked like a charm! Can't wait to try this on some other 'problem' shoes I have.
customer_reviews.author: Lunice A. Clay

customer_reviews.title: Life-changing and worth the $40
customer_reviews.text: I'm a woman with wide feet and bunions, which has made it literally impossible to find shoes that fit comfortably, even when buying wide shoes. I have successfully used this on a pair of leather flats and leather lace-up boots (didn't even bother with the bunion-specific attachment) . One thing -- if you plan to widen a pair of boots that have narrow ankles, I would recommend getting the version that stretches only width, as it can be hard to get this one inside the boot.
customer_reviews.author: Somebody Somewhere

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful piece of woodworking but flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Owned just under a year and hardly used. Already broken. Believe metal rod threads are stripped. Purchased this expensive item as it appeared sturdier and better finished thank the cheaper ones. Contacted company via email and no answer yet. Shows you don't always get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Uganda girl

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Only complaint would be is that it states it’s for shoe size 9 up. I wear a 9 and it is almost impossible to get in shoe. Had to trim wood where where block meets base so it would screw farther down. Now it fits great
customer_reviews.author: DAC

customer_reviews.title: High Quality!!
customer_reviews.text: What a high quality product!!! I am so impressed with the craftsmanship of this shoe stretcher!! It's heavy, but does the job just right!!! Kind of weird that these aren't sold in pairs. I bought two anyway. They work great on stiff leather loafers!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this! It works just like the old shoe ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this! It works just like the old shoe stretchers that my folks had around the house when I was a kid. I have used this stretcher with and without the spray and have had great results both ways. This one also has a nice variety of what they call 'bunion/corn plugs' and a lot of holes to place them in. I don't have either of those problems, but I do have one foot that is wider across the toes. I put the largest plug into the hole near the big toe, put the stretcher on overnight and the next morning, the sandals fit perfectly and I've been wearing them comfortably ever since.
customer_reviews.author: Sisak

customer_reviews.title: Best shoe stretcher on the market.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Foot Fitter I've purchased, as I needed a smaller model for my wife's shoes. This one works flawlessly, just like it's big brother. The quality is second to none and will last forever. Make sure to use the Foot Fitter leather spray prior to use as directed, it makes a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Bill M.

customer_reviews.title: Hopeful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item 6 months ago. It did work on a couple of pair of shoes. Recently I purchased a pair of shoes that required stretching and the stretcher doesn’t work. I am hopeful by contacting the company they will be able to assist me in getting it to work again.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Andrews

customer_reviews.title: they were painful to wear
customer_reviews.text: My velvet Gucci flats and patent leather Ferragamos were purchased a half-size down from what I normally wear because I adored the styles but sadly, of course, they were painful to wear. They have been sitting quietly in my closet for a few years now and so I was contemplating donating them. However, I found this two-way stretcher and decided to give it a go. I really didn't expect much but WOW was I glad this purchase was made. Now I have two pair of timeless well made flats that I wear comfortably thanks to the Foot Fitter 2-Way Shoe Stretcher! Thanks :)
customer_reviews.author: Yu Pa

customer_reviews.title: Weak Metal = Stripped Threads
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was the last shoe stretcher I'd ever buy, but the threads stripped as I was using the widener, only two hours after it was delivered! The wood was nice quality, but they need to upgrade their threaded rod and other vital metal parts. I'm returning it, because I don't need a paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: XL is NOT big enough for men sized 14 much less sized 16
customer_reviews.text: Mine says M (Men) XL (XLarge) for 14-16. My shoes are men 14 and while the design is wonderful, I wanted to stretch my left one (after surgery) to be slightly longer. No go. Tightened to the max just barely puts pressure on the toe of the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis R. King

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Stretcher
customer_reviews.text: The pre-review questions are irrelevant: this is a shoe STRETCHER, not a shoe! As a stretcher, this is one of the best I've ever seen and I speak as the 'shoe lady'....I spent my career as the owner operator of several shoe repair businesses as well as a wholesale dealer of supplies and products for such businesses. Very sturdy made so it will last, and where so many don't, this one works perfectly. I would definitely recommend this stretcher.
customer_reviews.author: D. Petty

customer_reviews.title: Only worked once!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two units, one of them worked once, I have never received an Item of such bad quality, now, I need to find some other brand that actually works. The mechanism just turns endlessly without opening the wooden part.
customer_reviews.author: David H

customer_reviews.title: Buy one size smaller
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 12, but the large was so big, it would not fit in my shoe. The medium does, but just barely. It has to get in the shoe before it can stretch it... right? (note: Mist/moisten the inside before you stretch the leather. It will work better and faster without damaging the shoe.)
customer_reviews.author: MiamiBeachDrew

customer_reviews.title: great design solid
customer_reviews.text: great design solid, built to last lots of adjustment options unfortunately the metal parts rust pretty quickly im not sure if im missing something, but it doesnt seem to be able to stretch my shoes too much, maybe half a size only? maaaybe one size? ill keep trying and will update this review if i have better results later
customer_reviews.author: sascha krohn

customer_reviews.title: This product design appears to be superb, with the ...
customer_reviews.text: This product design appears to be superb, with the ability to stretch width and length, as well as to accommodate for bunions. I have two unworn (new) pairs of leather shoes that I've had for almost a year, as a bunion I've had has gotten larger on my left foot. The stretcher mechanism fits perfectly in the shoe and while the design is flawless, and the bunion plugs customizable, the device did nothing to stretch the shoe, nor to enlarge the toe box area, even leaving the device in place for a couple of days. I will sadly be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Susan B. Markisz

customer_reviews.title: Strong and Effective
customer_reviews.text: I have bought several shoe stretchers, but this is the best I've used. Stretches length as well as width. Heavy duty reinforced wood and metal parts allow shows to be stretched in short order (1-2 days vs a week). Especially effective with shoe stretching spray (inside and out).
customer_reviews.author: William R. Yount

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to stretch out a pair of uncomfortable climbing shoes. The other units looked like they weren't very sturdy with the screw mechanism being made of plastic. This is all heavy metal and I can't imagine it breaking. It really is a quality product I would expect to last a lifetime. So did it stretch out the climbing shoes? You bet! But they are rubber and basically went right back to their original size. Now my wife uses it to stretch out her sandals, etc. Very happy with the purchase even though my climbing shoes still work.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pitts

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine initially. Bought since it was supposed to be heavy duty professional quality item. Used it several times (home/non business use only) and now threads are stripped and it will not expand against shoe. Body of object seems to be made well but the metal screw portion must be made from cheap metal for the threads to strip this easily. Very disappointed. Now it's a $40 paper weight.
customer_reviews.author: mark butler

customer_reviews.title: it is perfect. No not vacillate
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this stretcher because the one I had was broken. I decided to replaced with this one, it is perfect. No not vacillate, pick up this one for foot comfort. It is perfect. Beatriz
customer_reviews.author: Beatriz M. Killigan

customer_reviews.title: Women’s shoe size was 8 1/2 so would buy a large not a medium as recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Bought recommended size for shoe size but product was slightly undersized. 8 1/2 shoe size so bought a recommended medium but was a little small. Also product did not come with spot shoe stretchers that was pictured so returned it. Product was very well made though
customer_reviews.author: Richard D. Storm

customer_reviews.title: I love this product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! I do not have wide feet. However, my feet are a little wider then a M. If the toe box is not pointed the shoe will fit great. I have a lot of shoes that fix but would be great if just a tad wider. I bought this shoe stretcher and love it!!!!! My ankle boots all fit great! I got one stretcher at first, but it was taking too long to stretch my shoes! I bought a second! The stretcher also made a few pair of shoes that felt a half size too small fit great!!
customer_reviews.author: CH

customer_reviews.title: Good quality shoe stretcher
customer_reviews.text: This woman's shoe stretcher is high quality, and can work on a variety of shoe issues. It adjusts easily for length and width. There are also little "plugs" to position on it for a variety of personal foot issues, like bunions, corns, etc. I used it without any kind of spray product to try to both widen and raise the toe beds on a couple of pairs of walking shoes. The directions said to leave it in the shoe for 8 hours, but I did it for 24, just for added stretch. Worked very well for the shoes, and did what I wanted it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Linda H

customer_reviews.title: works fine/solid construction/may need to use more than once to get desired stretch
customer_reviews.text: this shoe stretcher worked great i was expecting a cheap one based on other reviews but this was all heavy metal and wood (excluding the toe bumps which are plastic) i used rubbing alcohol to spray the outside of the leather shoe put the stretcher in and turned the crank until it expanded all the way left over night i did this several times in each shoe sometimes with the bumpers in different spots i needed by shoes nice and roomy all through the toe box and was pleased with the results now I have two pairs of ankle boots I can wear
customer_reviews.author: M. Drake

customer_reviews.title: Not very pleased since I am unable to the toe wider
customer_reviews.text: I am trying to stretch the 'leather band across the toe' of a ladies sandal (size 8m). This leather band was sewn a little short on one shoe by the manufacturer. It is not working because the 2-way stretcher will not tighten or spread wide enough to stretch the leather. I purposely ordered the 'premium' stretcher since other reviews say they break, not well made, etc. Not very pleased since I am unable to the toe wider.
customer_reviews.author: MJM

customer_reviews.title: Very solid, works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because I have very large and wide feet. I picked this unit because I read some other reviews indicating that lesser/cheaper stretchers tend to crack. I've had this for about three weeks now and it's been in one shoe or another the whole time, stretching away. This seems to me to be a very heavy duty unit, and I can't imagine it breaking. Ever. In fact, I'd be more concerned with the possibility of ripping the stitching on a good pair of shoes than with ever breaking the stretcher. One note of caution. I wear 14 4E and this fits my shoes fine. If you're closer to 11 you might opt for the next size down.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: I'm Satisfied....
customer_reviews.text: To be perfectly honest, I received my item just before the weekend. I used the shoe stretcher along with Moneysworth shoe stretcher. I found that I got the best result leaving the shoe stretcher in the shoe overnight. I did see good results. I have not yet worn my shoes out in public for any distant in walking. However, I did feel a difference when I tried them on. I will also add that I paid a shoe repair store prior to purchasing these items, and did not feel a real difference. I got better result with the shoe stretcher and Moneysworth shoe stretcher working together.
customer_reviews.author: Glen

customer_reviews.title: I wear a size 8. 5 and the Men's ...
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 8.5 and the Men's smallest size was too large. I replaced it with the smallest Lady size. In terms of how it fits in mens? as you would guess it doesn't fully envelope the shoe, but it works more or less.... I do have one warning -- The inner metal piece that functions as the primary stretcher (the thing that extends the two wooden pieces) will pop out of place if you keep turning the (knob?) -- Do not panic, the metal rod piece just needs to be placed back into the two wooden grooves.
customer_reviews.author: Moon T. Kim

customer_reviews.title: A quality, well-built product. I bought the 9-11 ...
customer_reviews.text: A quality, well-built product. I bought the 9-11 model and had a hard time getting them into my size 9 shoes. They didn't solve my problem because I could not get them deep enough into the toe to stretch the part of the shoe that was causing the discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: Too many toys

customer_reviews.title: The sizing description is wrong.
customer_reviews.text: The size description on this shoe stretcher is way way off. It was way too big to stretch a woman's pair of shoes despite their description. I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda R.

customer_reviews.title: Nice stretcher, works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: The Foot Fitter seems to be a well made piece of equipment. I have successfully used it to stretch 2 shoes to accomodate a bunion that is becoming more sensitive. It worked wonderfully in those limited tests! I bought the women's medium stretcher to stretch women's size 7 1/2 shoes, it was a bit difficult getting the stretcher into the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: DAH

customer_reviews.title: 2-Way Shoe Stretcher Worked Just Fine!
customer_reviews.text: With the questions asked you would think I bought a pair of shoes. This item is a shoe stretcher, it did a fine job of stretching the width of one of my shoes (left) that was tight on the inside. Also purchased some spray stretcher, sprayed this first and then put the two-way stretcher to work. Left the stretcher in the shoe for several hours and then tried the shoe on, it worked. May need to use the stretcher in the future, but now I own this item and can use whenever I need it. This stretcher worked just fine.
customer_reviews.author: R. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Wish they gave a discount for buying 2 items
customer_reviews.text: I brought this stretcher for some designer high top sneakers that were snug on the sides. Since the shoe stretcher only comes with one I have to do the shoes at different times. I already stretched one and so far so good. The shoe feels lose around the sides. The 4 star rating is because i wish there was a discount for buying 2 units it would make the process quicker. Over all good product and great quality.
customer_reviews.author: danielle cumberbatch

customer_reviews.title: I am thrilled with the excellent quality of them Again - very expensive by comparison ...
customer_reviews.text: I returned a much cheaper set because they broke on the first use. These are expensive but worth EVERY penny!! I bought 2 so I could do both shoes at the same time. They are so well made and did the job for me. I am thrilled with the excellent quality of them Again - very expensive by comparison to others available............but you will not be disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: Donna Mae

customer_reviews.title: Best shoe stretcher
customer_reviews.text: Best shoe stretcher I've found on Amazon. I tried several. This has a quality handle, which is a problem on other brands. It's strong enough to stretch out quality leather shoes, 1/2 size for me. My shoes feel fantastic now. Very worthwhile product. The images at this time make the womens stretcher look the same as mens. The shape is different, so make sure to buy the proper gender, it's not just a size difference. I think the womens are more appropriate for high heels.
customer_reviews.author: Songster

customer_reviews.title: Too large for size 11 mens
customer_reviews.text: The men's medium stretcher, according to the description was supposed to fit "Mens Medium (US 9 - 11)" but it was 1.25 inches too long to go into any of my size 11 shoes. Returned. It seems like a good quality item as it is all wood and metal except for one turning knob, so one star for quality - but it still doesn't work. I can't imagine why they would say that it would work for US men's size 9 or 10.
customer_reviews.author: J. frazier

customer_reviews.title: One of the best purchases I’ve ever made.
customer_reviews.text: One of the best purchases I’ve ever made. I have a wide foot but going a half size up doesn’t help so this stretches my shoes perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Keller

customer_reviews.title: Threads stripped on first pair of shoes, but customer service was excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I had expected something of higher quality. On the first pair of shoes, the threads stripped. Upon leaving the review, I was contacted by the customer service team and my issue was promptly resolved. I will be returning the defective unit and receiving a replacement. Five stars simply for caring enough to address a customer need!
customer_reviews.author: Greg Dalzell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect accessory
customer_reviews.text: I have used this on two pairs of shoes so far that were almost unwearable at first, but have now become some of my favorites due to their improved fit. I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: pes7

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy, but you only get one (not a pair).
customer_reviews.text: This is well made and will probably last a long long time, but I did not expect to only get one for this price. I guess I should not have skimmed over the fine print, but I assumed that the vast majority of us have 2 shoes to fill...
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Shoe Stretcher
customer_reviews.text: Very well built, with solid materials and ease of use. The spot stretchers that slot into the main body work very well at stretching 'rub' spots. These stretchers seem like they are going to last for a very long time!
customer_reviews.author: S.M.

customer_reviews.title: highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet and have been scanning the internet for years for shoes that are wide enough that actually look good. Cannot find such a thing in local stores. Recently bought this item and have been happily stretching my shoes into submission. Just can't believe I did not try this before. And this product is of particularly high quality. You only get one (not a pair) in an order, but that should not be a problem. I just stretch each shoe for a day at a time. Just used this on soccer shoes/cleats, which unfortunately do not come in wide sizes at all. Problem solved. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Chris K.

customer_reviews.title: AMAZON a safe alternative for Christmas shopping this year.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, but most important is that AMAZON services prevents the spread of COVID to the masses, I did not have to shop among browsers and handle products that were touched...in the end,I bought what I wanted and probably could not find on my own.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Polzinski

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this on a pair of tight shoes for a week and has made the shoes more comfortable. I am wearing the shoes without any problems. The product seems to be very sturdy and well made.
customer_reviews.author: peppie24

customer_reviews.title: Great design, poor material choice
customer_reviews.text: Worked great to widen where I wanted, problem is the material choice in the screw mechanism stripped 2 shoes in. Was able to return within 30 day warrantee period. Seeing similar comments.
customer_reviews.author: Chris A Zona

product_meta.title: FootFitter Premium Professional 2-Way Shoe Stretcher- Stretches Length and Width
product_meta.description:
PRODUCT DETAILS
 * Is Discontinued By Manufacturer :No
 * Product Dimensions :15.8 x 5.1 x 4.1 inches; 1.85 Pounds
 * Item model number :101-001-21
 * Department :Mens
 * Date First Available :April 22, 2007
 * ASIN :B000PMPTE0

 * Amazon Best Sellers Rank: #28,345 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry (See Top 100 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry)  *  #25 inShoe & Boot Trees 
   
   

 * Customer Reviews:4.3 out of 5 stars1,841 ratings
feature_bullets: 2-WAY STRETCHER: Efficiently Stretches Length & Width of Shoes!
SINGLE STRETCHER: Single Stretcher Only! Can Be Used for Right & Left Shoes!
BEECH WOOD: Beautifully Polished German Harvested Beech Wood.
SPOT RELIEF: Includes 3 Bunion/Corn Plugs and 16 Holes for Customizable Relief!
INSTRUCTIONS: Includes Comprehensive Shoe Stretching User Manual
